website_summaries.verdict: Cuisinart's best model on almost every front. Hands down the best when it comes to power, features, and smooth operation.
pros: Powerful 1300W motor, numerous touchpad controls, and Bladelock system
We love its 14-cup capacity, additional 4.5-cup bowl, and fairly quiet operation
cons: Some concerns w/the grating disk chopping too thickly

customer_reviews.title: Control buttons failed in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine on December 28, 2017 and have used it 10--15 times, mostly for chopping a few vegetables or making hummus. Last week I pulled it out of the cupboard and none of the control buttons work. Using up my cell-phone minutes, I discovered after almost an hour that I have to pay $40 shipping to get a replacement base. I am very disappointed in Cuisinart. I have 6-7 of their appliances, but will consider carefully before buying another one. Their customer service is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Splcgirl

customer_reviews.title: Engineer design not a cooks tool
customer_reviews.text: Shredding and slicing blade does not fit to the edge of the bowl. Large chuncks of food end up in the bowl. Blade sits too low in the bowl and large portion of food being cut up is lost
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Steele

customer_reviews.title: Great machine -- and quiet
customer_reviews.text: I love how quiet this food processor is. It has a lot of really great features, such as the chopping blade locking in so you don't have to worry about if falling out when scraping things out of the bowl. The slicing blade is adjustable. I use this all the time for chopping, slicing and pureeing. The top has a removable gasket (so you can clean under it) that provides a tight seal, keeping liquids from leaking out when the bowl is full. I'm really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Whitebear

customer_reviews.title: Very poor grating disc.
customer_reviews.text: This machine works easily and sets up well, but has some serious faults: like many other customers, I found the grating disc to work very poorly. The slices are too thick, and huge chunks of food are left. Every onion, potato, fruit or vegetable are fully sliced through. The pusher for the feed tube and the top of the Cuisinart do not come together tightly enough, so the shredder doesn't create the right texture of grated foods. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ozmatoo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Food Processor!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mom as Xmas gift. She loves it. She has been using it at least 4 times a week for cooking. Very powerful. Haven’t have problem chop anything. We also order additional julienne disc. Works like a charm. She prefer thin straight stripe cut for potato, squash and radish, over curly spiralized “noodle”. It is more east to saute that way. No tangling. We also own the classical inspired DFP-14. Between these most popular Cuisinart Food Processors, my mom prefers the new FP-12. It has more power, takes less space with the adjustable discs. It also has a smaller bowl for more versatile use.
customer_reviews.author: JY

customer_reviews.title: Cannot grate baby carrots
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to grate baby carrots with this machine. The shredding disc does not go all the way to the edge of the bowl allowing the carrots to fall straight into the bowl. I had an Hamilton Beach for years that would grate them perfectly-should have stayed with it and saved a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Machine very quiet when using, no moving around on counter, easy cleaning, dices/chops beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. So far have only used for chopping because it was the main reason for buying. I have issues with my chopping hand and a rough chop is ok but dicing, small chopping doesn’t cut it anymore. I also love the clean up, takes less then 5 mins. Also very happy with the weight and motor. Very quiet when using and the machine doesn’t move around on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in new design.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Cuisinart because I had used a friend's at church and loved it. I'm very disappointed in this new design. The handle is now in the front instead of the back, which is awkward. Worst of all is the new lid that doesn't turn and click to close. Instead it requires brute force, which is difficult for this aged user. Also, I'm afraid that the lid won't last long because of the force necessary to close it. Bring back the old design. It didn't need to be changed.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret D. Roland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works very well and fast
customer_reviews.text: This machine is easy to put together, clean and to use. It has sharp blades and will chop an entire bowl of vegetables in less than 30 seconds! Very easy and quick to use. If you do any kind of cooking and want to buy items in bulk instead of pre-cut items (will save money), this machine will help you make use of those savings! Consumer report also recommends this food processor
customer_reviews.author: Savta

customer_reviews.title: High quality performance.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best food processor I have had and I have used many including other model Cuisinart and Kitchenaid. This FP Series Diecast Elite Collection 14 cup is much easier to use, top attaches easily. Not unreasonably loud in my opinion. Very speedy and convenient. Removeable gasket is easy to clean and assemble. Weight of machine keeps it in place without annoyingly vibrating itself across the counter. I am, to say the least, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: llindalu

customer_reviews.title: Returned Twice
customer_reviews.text: We bought this unit from Amazon. The motor works on and off. Has a mind of its own. We returned and got it replaced by Amazon. Same issue. Suspect design issues. Returning the 2nd unit today. Never had issues with Cuisinart before. Totally disappointed with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: TexansRule

customer_reviews.title: Love this Food Processor just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Today 1-13-2018 I received my Cuisinart FP-12BCN Elite Collection Food Processor, it works fantastic. It’s heavy so it doesn’t move around. I was anxious to try it so tested it by doing: Shredded raw potatoes for hash browns, and sliced apples both turned out perfect. I did take my time reading all the instructions before setting it up and alll the functions for the different blades. So many other food processor are cheaply made and this is not. The. Package came nicely packaged so it wouldn’t get damaged in shipping. One from the supplier and then Amazon shipping carton.
customer_reviews.author: Ldarr

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: To start off, I want to mention I’m a very good cook, it’s my thing. I buy good equipment. I had bought a very expensive Breville food processor thinking I bought the best. I was so disappointed in it, then the bowl broke. $200 for a new bowl. Forget about it! So I did some research and settled on this Cuisiinart. Oh where have you been all my life! Wonder machine. Powerful, great attachments, retractable cord. Nice box to store attachments in. Wow! All the attachments work very well, and the chopping power is impressive! And bread dough! It kneads up bread in nothing flat! I highly recommend the machine. I don’t believe you’ll be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: mike d.

customer_reviews.title: pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: pros: heavy so doesnt move around easy to lock and unlock for safety adjustable slicer from thick to thin without having multiple blades small bowl fits inside large bowl cons: is large, and tall,for those with limited space, and too heavy to move around easily small bowl is not usable separately large bowl is quite large, difficult in dishwasher more difficult to clean some of the parts than my old cuisinart processor
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best one I have used
customer_reviews.text: I love this food processor. I used to have a kitchen aid and this one is far superior. It is quiet and powerful. I have shredded, chopped and processed several types of foods without any problem. It has included cheeses, vegetables and nuts. I have made salsa in it as well. The blades are really sharp and cut easily (be careful when washing them). Cleaning this one is so much simpler than my old one. You can take out the rubber pieces / gaskets easily so that you can clean out all the crevices when little bits of food get stuck.
customer_reviews.author: JRose

customer_reviews.title: Great for my marriage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my husband whined about how loud my Kitchenaid food processor was. Honestly, the best part about using my old model was I couldn’t hear him grump over the ridiculous noise of the underpowered motor. Don’t tell him I said this, but this new Quisenart is magical! It’s fast. It’s versatile. It’s not a huge pain to clean, and best of all, it’s not going to be a contributing factor to my eventual need for hearing aids. Spent more on this than I would’ve liked to, but my husband is happy ...so there’s that.
customer_reviews.author: Fiddler

customer_reviews.title: Broke down in 18 months
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well until it broke down only after 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long???
customer_reviews.text: This is fabulous! I can't believe how easy it is to use and a snap to clean. I leave it on the counter and I've become quite good with home made pie crusts...Grates 2 lbs of cheese in seconds, and shreds and slices faster than I could EVER hope to do. After seeing for herself how easy it sliced cucumbers and onions, my sister in law purchased one too! Pricey for me but hopefully it will last for years!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. C. Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is my first food processor and I think I’m going to love it! So far, I’ve made hummus which was delicious and bread crumbs out of pork rinds. Both were simple and easy to do. When I first got it, I thought it was huge. But the smaller bowl that comes with it works out fine. I found a place to store it and I’m all set.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Safety Latch is Temperamental
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Cuisinart with a perfectly good motor but chopping blade that cannot be replaced. It has been a disappointment. The shredding blade allows food to slip between the blade edge and work bowl so food ends up in lumps in the bowl. After one year the safety feature that prevents the processor from running if the lid is not on became on again/off again. Now I frequently have to play with the placement of the bowl or push down on the top to get it to run.
customer_reviews.author: Math Tutor

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a food processor, not a blender.
customer_reviews.text: A major disappointment. The motor is over-powered, and it basically has one speed: Tornado puree. Because there aren't different speeds, it's terrible at chopping. You have to cut food into pretty small pieces, put only a small amount in, and then pulse carefully or else everything turns to mush. Causes a lot of extra work, and sometimes ruined results. I'm almost hoping this thing breaks down so I can replace it. Hideously overpriced for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Lance90

customer_reviews.title: GROSS
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS USED. The box was taped shut, the styrofoam inside the product box was broken apart and all over the box and product. There’s gross fingerprints on the clear plastic that aren’t mine, I just opened it and haven’t touched it. There’s crumbs in the bottom of the box and oily smudges all over the base. GROSS. AMAZON!?!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I love this food processor
customer_reviews.text: I love this food processor. It is easy to use and remarkably quiet! The sauces come out creamy even without added oil. We made "ice cream" out of nothing but frozen bananas and frozen strawberries. It took a little bit of stopping and moving the food around a little bit, but then it just kind of broke loose and made the creamiest treat we have ever made. You will be glad you bought this! I bought the 14 cup capacity and it is big and perfect for families or those who like to work in larger batches. The small bowl is perfect for small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: PianoMom54

customer_reviews.title: Professional Grade at Great Price
customer_reviews.text: A little larger and heavier than expected, but in a good way...not you basic food processor. Love the variable thickness slicer, they didn't explain that well in the ad - slicer blade can adjust in increments from 1 to 10mm. Great guide for speed/blade use for different foods.
customer_reviews.author: James A

customer_reviews.title: Leaky small appliance
customer_reviews.text: I am returning f.p. it leaks, I filled liquid to the max line 2x's. I am not thrilled, as I bought the french fry disk for $40.00 it only fits fp-12n elite, both get returned, yes I am discouraged Cusinart formely made a good product.
customer_reviews.author: San Kay

customer_reviews.title: This Is A Great Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: I had one for years and it finally fell apart. I bought this and it works superb. It has some updated features like a smaller bowl that fits into the bigger one when you have smaller amount to chop, grind, etc. Great concept. It also comes with a box to hold all the attachments which is nice to be able to find that certain part when you need it. Great job in the design. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: April Shark

customer_reviews.title: Best food processor i ever had...
customer_reviews.text: i like the double bowl because i don't always want to make a big quantity. Pastry dough is fast and easy to make. All the cutting disks are included so i use it about everyday to slice, dice veggies or shred cheese. I love it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Colette Singla

customer_reviews.title: Usable capacity is 8 cups not 12. Quality questionable and unlikely to last.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace ninja whose bowl broke (for second time) primarily to blend/puree home made dog food. Was immediately disappointed in bowl size. Although claiming to be 12 cups usable capacity is only 8. Anything more will flow over the blade holder down the middle all over the base unit as soon as you try to remove the bowl. The blade lock is un reliable and can easily detach when removing bowl. The lid lock mechanism also doesn't appear to be very sturdy and the tiny locking tab on the front of the bowl looks fragile and price for replacement bowls if available seems high. Too many concerns after unpacking so I returned it
customer_reviews.author: Occasional Buyer

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of food processors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift and they have been very pleased with it. Still too new to rate on durability but the quality of this product is outstanding. It can do so any things. I will caution it is large and heavy so if you're not leaving it on your countertop you'd need a big space in your cupboard to store it. Well worth it though. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy-duty processing
customer_reviews.text: I love Cuisinart, and I love their food processors have good reputations. However, this one definitely does not live up to its hype (if there is one). Whatever I'm processing leaks or spills out of the small hole in the lid, and the motor started to burn very quickly after about a month of using (right after the return window closed. ha!) so this sucks. Breville might be worth the extra $.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: It makes great peanut butter and it's built like a tank.
customer_reviews.text: A very quiet tank at that. It's quiet and quietly powerful. I've used it to make several batches of peanut butter (put in your peanuts, turn it on and in about ten minutes you'll have creamy peanut butter. It chops up my tomatoes for sauce and saves me a lot of time. This is the best food processor I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: rick sparks

customer_reviews.title: Excellent time saving machine!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item to chop veggies, liver, and other ingredients for my homemade dog food. What use to take me an hour or more now takes less than a few minutes. I am still amazed every time I use it! I usually start with the large container full and within a minute I have a well chopped mixture. So easy and all the components go in the dishwasher!
customer_reviews.author: luv2read

customer_reviews.title: Awesome,  just Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Strong motor. Quiet. Very flexible. Blends dough quickly and efficiently leaving no residual on bottom. Anxious to try some of the recipes in the manual. It was a decision between this food processor and a new stand mixer -for making bread dough etc. So very glad that I chose the Cuisinart FP.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Smart Design and SO Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more delighted with this Cuisinart FP-12BKN Elite Food Processor. Love the smaller bowl that nests inside the larger one for making smaller batches -- and cleaning smaller messes. Smart design. Most amazing is how q-u-i-e-t the motor is. Compared to my many-years old food processor, the advancement in quiet technology is revolutionary! This model seems really well-built, worth the money, and I look forward to using this Cuisinart for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C. Slay

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any cook.
customer_reviews.text: If you like to cook from scratch this is a must have appliance. I grate all my own cheese with this so I don't get the sawdust added to grated cheese. I make my own hummus (big money savings). There are a thousand things you can use this for to eat healthier.
customer_reviews.author: J Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Easy to use & power
customer_reviews.text: After doing A WHOLE LOT of research on food processors I ultimately decided to go with this model & so glad that I did! I opted for the bigger motor due to what I was buying it for, so don't get me wrong it's a little on the heavy side, but that's ok with me because the performance is awesome. It works great, easy to use, love the safety features, easy to clean up. The only thing I wish is that this model had a storage unit for the extra blades etc like some other models have.
customer_reviews.author: Krista S.

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for a couple of months and have used it to dice, slice & grate. It takes seconds to slice potatoes for the whole family. Love the attachment case / everything in one place and easy to find. The base is heavy, so I keep it on the countertop, rather than lift to/from appliance pantry. Blades are very sharp - take extreme care when handling or you’ll end up getting stitches... I learned that the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A Klausner

customer_reviews.title: A very good kitchen product used for preparing food.
customer_reviews.text: Food processing. A great product. Does everything. More quieter than the older models. Easy to clean, but wash the top by hand so you don't stretch the rubber out. Suggest you get the case for the attachments. Only problem, they conk out after 3 years. My third one. If it conks out this time, I'm moving on.
customer_reviews.author: barbara a. brown

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOOD PROCESSOR!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My niece recommended this food processor to me and she was right as it works really good and I am pleased with my purchase. It's easy to operate and to clean up and it does a great job for me. I would buy again. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: I would not but it again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas. It's very quiet and I'm sure it has a good motor but it's pretty no frills. Only 3 buttons on, off and pulse. I was disappointed in that.
customer_reviews.author: Pam B.

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A MACHINE!
customer_reviews.text: AN INCREDIBLE BLENDER- SEEMS TO BE ABLE TO DO ALMOST ANYTHING. WILL TAKE MY SPOUSE MORE THAN ONE OR TWO SESSIONS TO BECOME THOROUGHLY FAMILIAR WITH ITS OPERATIONS. SO FAR, SHE REALLY LIKES IT AND IS LEARNING A LOT ABOUT "BLENDERIZING"!
customer_reviews.author: Henry C. Cernansky

customer_reviews.title: The best food processor in the world
customer_reviews.text: I had this same food processor ~10 years ago and used it about 5 days per week during those 10 years. I literally made everything in it- homemade laundry soup, hummus, nut butter, soups, etc. Finally it started to get weaker- dull blade and slowing motor. It's something I couldn't live without so I ordered the same one again. It works just was wonderfully as the last one and will certainly give me many years of heavy use! This is a kitchen essential!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: glad we made this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had to be convenienced to make this purchase. I watched several reviews on this processor and a few others that I was considering. It's easy to clean, sturdy, and simple to use. The purchase was made with the intent to make baby food and pie crust. This machine has been successful thus far in both.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia S.

customer_reviews.title: Still getting use to using
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with my purchase. I called customer service (disappointment) to figure it all out.. she told me to go to youtube.. I am still experimenting with it so I should know better in 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: chrisbst

customer_reviews.title: Powerful & quiet
customer_reviews.text: So far I love everything about this processor. I have used it two times, it's easy to clean, the accessories are awesome, the motor is super quiet and powerful. Loving it!!
customer_reviews.author: Berta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect not too big Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: This was a christmas gift for my wife and she loves it! I thought it might be too big but she is happy. The flexibility to use the smaller bowl is a big plus. She also loves the storgae box for the blades. Its practical and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Leon

customer_reviews.title: Great food Processor
customer_reviews.text: SOOOOO much better than my small Kitchenaid, but takes up a lot more space on my counter, too. Much less costly than my neighbor's Breville, and really does the same things, just as well. Machine is sturdy and will last a very long time, I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: Marie C. Sepeta

customer_reviews.title: Big and heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious food processor. It’s almost too big for day to day stuff. Unfortunately I don’t have room to leave it on my counter so I am hauling it up every time I need it. But I used to have a cheaper one that couldn’t handle the largest toughest jobs. This is a great machine so far!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Walk

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a chef. It's super quiet and makes quick work if anything I have put in it. Accidentally made chicken breadcrumbs while intending to shred cooked chicken! Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Girard

customer_reviews.title: Power, and an adjustable slicing disk--heaven.
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable slicing disk is just wonderful--as far as I can tell, the first among the rationally priced processors. The one drawback, which I have yet to overcome, is having the last of the carrots (and the like) I am slicing go horizontal and end up riding on top or the disk. Perhaps using the smaller work bowl would help.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Charles

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: When I received this item there were many pieces missing...sealing lid, pushers, spatula. I had to call Cuisinart and get the missing parts straight from the company, not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, works well and is nice to look at. It is so hard to pick the right food processor and we took a long time to decide, but are very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson MacFarlane

customer_reviews.title: Modern love
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my 25 year old model with this. GREAT machine with many features. Love it as much as the last Cuisinart i owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Blinkowski

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: I canned homemade salsa, and I canned sauerkraut. I absolutely love the slicer because it allows the user to pick the thickness. This food processor made it all so easy and fast!! It is worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: LexRose

customer_reviews.title: Works great a very professional peice of equipment
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend getting the blade holder also otherwise it is dangerous to store. It works great though!
customer_reviews.author: Dianeomite

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw in shredder and slicer
customer_reviews.text: The shredder is having design flaw, it doesn't shreds the carrots that are baby carrots.The baby carrots escape the gap between shredder.I never expected this.
customer_reviews.author: 4k10

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my old Kitchen Aide 11 cup. It came before Christmas just in time for baking etc. Great for everything I do . Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Crook

customer_reviews.title: Want the best? Here it is.
customer_reviews.text: If you want your last food processor, just order this. If you wish to buy yet another that disappoints order something else. Quiet. Powerful. Easy to clean and use. No regrets here.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Joe Brown

customer_reviews.title: Check in out in the store first.
customer_reviews.text: This machine is solid. Works well but you will need a large space for it's storage. Also, the parts that need washing are many. Just saying'.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon's description of LED Lights is totally inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: There are no LED Lights! The only LED Light is a tiny dot on the ON button. Not enough to even mention. I called Cuisinart to be sure because of the description and also the picture of the blue line across the top of the buttons on Amazon. Can't you just be honest! I'm just about done with Amazon. I think I will shop locally and be done with it. Easy returns, no deceptive descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: GriffinK

customer_reviews.title: Large and Steel Chopping blad did not fit and is un usable
customer_reviews.text: I paid a lot for a processer that will not cut in the bottom cuter.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J.

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Extremely heavy to handle. Returned and bought a smaller version from another store. I wish the motor could be lighter in weight with suction cups to keep it steady..
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Our old one lasted 20+ years. Been used for everything, including making dough for home-made pasta. Cuisinart has come a long way! Recommend this one for all your needs. I believe this one will last 20+ years as well1
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Rosa

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty motor
customer_reviews.text: This processor is fast and is able to handle a large amount. It slices apples in record time. The adjustable slicing blade is a nice feature. My only problem is where to store it as it is heavy and tall. I think that I will use it more than my mixer so may swap them out to put on the kitchen counter. It's easy to use and fast.
customer_reviews.author: jmp

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I love the way the chopping blade stays in the unit when I pour out its contents.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my wife...she loves it.
customer_reviews.text: All Pluses. The only negative is the unit is a little heavy. A small price to pay for a commercial type unit!
customer_reviews.author: PJS9370

customer_reviews.title: It will meet your expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I have just started using this food processor so I can’t really evaluate its durability. It works very well and has done a fine job of pulverizing what I have asked it to. I really like the 4-cup work bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Cody

customer_reviews.title: shredding disc is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The shredding disc does not work on baby carrots. I called Cuisinart to report this and they sent me a new disc. It does not work any better! A very expensive food processor should work better than this!
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Seelig

customer_reviews.title: Quisinart blender
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but trouble with this blender. On Pulse setting I get 2 pulses and shuts off and then will not come back on no matter what I try.
customer_reviews.author: dan gollehon

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: The top doesn’t latch on easily when using the smaller top processor bowl, but otherwise really nice!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Neuman

customer_reviews.title: The best food processor.
customer_reviews.text: I love this food processor. It is easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Avellino-Bakacs

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: It did not work when I received it. Had to send back
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Simple, powerful and QUIET
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly quiet! What used to take me hours with the old loud tiny food processor is now just a 15 minute job. Super capacity and easy to clean. I thought I was gonna miss the speed settings but it isn't a problem.
customer_reviews.author: ABRAHAM E PLATA

customer_reviews.title: Makes cooking easier!
customer_reviews.text: I love the slicer for onions and potatoes. Use to chop all types of vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used twice and no longer works. Initially thought this would be great and a time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Chi-Girl

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Made quick work when grinding ginger. It is heavy so be aware. Wife loves the power and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for wife.. she just loves this machine.. easy to use, the new bowl sizes and they fit in each other.. awesome.. Easier to pour, just an upgrade from old one..
customer_reviews.author: To5m Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: The metal base and sturdy construction give the product a nice weight
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing every single day. It is a kitchen workhorse capable of whatever you need to do. The metal base and sturdy construction give the product a nice weight, which helps keep the thing on the counter with it's insanely high-powered motor. The myriad of adjustable accessories and the small bowl attachment make it useful for literally any culinary situation. It is also great for dough, I use it to make pizza dough every week. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Glotz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it. So far I have used it for slicing (fabulous) and making nut butter (great).
customer_reviews.author: Candee Conklin

customer_reviews.title: Impressive product!
customer_reviews.text: All features are a Huge improvement over previous models. It is quiet, powerful, and works great!

customer_reviews.title: just get it!!
customer_reviews.text: qualty all the way. ten year on the motor. where do you get that?

customer_reviews.title: Best food processor I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This food processor is incredible I love everything about it! The power, the aesthetics, the box that holds all the attachments (had to buy separately but worth it)....I highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Copeland

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfully built, powerful machine! The Cuinart FP-14DCN Elite Collection is the best I have evr owned. Quiet - I can even use it while my family sleeps. Makes and easy chore of all my processing. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: From easily and quickly being able to make soups to grinding ...
customer_reviews.text: This has forever changed my life. From easily and quickly being able to make soups to grinding up peppermint to make ice cream on Christmas, this item is worth every penny and then some. I love it so much and use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Liv DeHaan

customer_reviews.title: Well-put-together machine
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. The two bowl sizes are a great feature. Cleans easily and is a great multipurpose machine.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: ... simplified in comparison to the previous ones I absolutely love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Although the model is simplified in comparison to the previous ones I absolutely love this machine.....quite and the accessories come with a case. A major plus for me. Worth every penny...or dollar.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So much at mixing while chopping than my (very) old model. Couldn't be happier with it.

customer_reviews.title: cooking is so much simpler with this and the product is so far so great!
customer_reviews.text: A must to have for the kitchen ; cooking is so much simpler with this and the product is so far so great!

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for shredding pears for gingered pear jam
customer_reviews.text: I used this right away! It worked great for shredding pears for gingered pear jam. Looking forward to more opportunities to prepare meals for my family. My niece stopped for a visit and wanted to take the model home with her!

customer_reviews.title: This is a huge time saver

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Ok it's my first food processor, so I really have nothing to compare it to, but it does seem like it's high quality and built to last.

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: Replaced our old cuisinart. Took a little while to get used to but LOVE it and love the handy case for storing parts ! It makes it so easy to access.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far. We use it for Indian Chapati dough works great. Other features are useful as well.

customer_reviews.title: good product, with the exception of the retractable cord
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for 5 months and really like it. The only thing that quit working (during the 4th month of ownership) is the retractable cord, which seemed to be troubled and unreliable from the beginning. Otherwise, a good product.

customer_reviews.title: I love this product

customer_reviews.title: This is a great food processor!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I use it frequently. I especially like the two bowl sizes for when I am doing a smaller batch.

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Well designed and built. The adjustable slicing disk and the reversible shredding disk are brilliant. My last cuisinart lasted more than 20 years and I expect this new one to last as long.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I had to return twice because the workbowl didn't lock and the motor wouldn't turn on.

product_meta.title: Cuisinart FP-14DCN Elite Collection 2.0 14 Cup Food Processor, Die Cast
product_meta.description: Color:Die CastEquipped with a 1300-watt peak-power induction motor, this convenient food processor quickly and easily slices, dices, chops, and purees, helping to reduce prep time in the kitchen. It supplies a 4-1/2-cup small work bowl that nest inside a 14-cup large work bowl--a versatile two-in-one design that can handle multiple-size batches. All the bowls feature durable polycarbonate construction, measurement marks up the side, and drip-free pour spouts. An exclusive SealTight Advantage System seals the bowls and locks the blades for clean, safe processing and pouring. In addition, the unit's wide-mouth feed tube accommodates larger ingredients, which reduces the need for cutting food into smaller pieces first, and its electronic touchpad control panel offers four selections for on, off, dough, and pulse. Accessories include a stainless-steel adjustable slicing disc (0 to 10 mm), a stainless-steel reversible shredding disc (fine/medium), a large and small stainless-steel chopping/mixing blade, and a dough blade. Thoughtfully designed, the food-prep appliance also provides blue LED indicator lights, a simple on/off locking system with push-button release, a retractable cord, and dishwasher-safe removable parts for quick cleanup. A lockable accessory storage case, spatula, and recipe/instruction book come included. The food processor measures 7-4/5 by 10-1/5 by 17 inches and carries a three-year limited warranty with a 10-year warranty on the motor.
feature_bullets: 14 cup Large Bowl and 4½ cup Small Bowl with Pour Spouts & Measurement Markings, Electronic Touchpad Controls – On/Off/ Dough/Pulse with Blue LED Lights, BPA Free, Spatula
1300 watt motor, Easy On/Off Locking System with Push-Button Release, Stainless Steel Adjustable Slicing Disc (up to 10mm). UC LWH- 20.00x13.00x15.75 Inches.MC LWH -21.00x13.50x16.25 Inches
Exclusive Patent-Pending SealTight Advantage System – Seals Bowls and Locks Blades, All Removable Parts Are Dishwasher Safe, Recipe/Instruction Book
Stainless Steel Reversible Shredding Disc(fine/medium), Dough Blade, 20-Year Motor Warranty, 3-Year Limited Warranty

Large and Small Stainless Steel Chopping/Mixing Blades with BladeLock System, Cuisinart Supreme Wide-Mouth Feed Tube and Cover Assembly, Accessory Storage Case with Lock, Retractable cord.UC Cubic Feet: 0.92
